snippet: Local law enforcement agencies have moved into what had been the domain of the F.B.I. and state crime labs, and the trend is expected only to accelerate after a recent Supreme Court decision.
abstract: Local law enforcement agencies nationwide are amassing their own DNA databases of potential suspects, raising privacy concerns; trend is expected to accelerate after Supreme Court's decision allowing authorities to collect DNA samples from those arrested for serious crimes.
lead_paragraph: Local law enforcement agencies have moved into what had been the domain of the F.B.I. and state crime labs, and the trend is expected only to accelerate after a recent Supreme Court decision.

headline.main: Police Agencies Are Assembling Records of DNA
headline.print_headline: Police Agencies Are Assembling Records of DNA
